channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14224] Fix coprocessor handling of duplicate classes
item.description: While discussing with Misty Stanley-Jones over on HBASE-13907 we noticed some inconsistency when copros are loaded. Sometimes you can load them more than once, sometimes you can not. Need to consolidate.
item.summary: Fix coprocessor handling of duplicate classes

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Attached a PDF that describes the issue in detail.
Yep, I figured that too. Also depending if you are using the Shell or the Java API you don't have the same behaviour...
BTW, most of the lines in your attached document are truncated

Easy to fix, in CoprocessorHost.loadSystemCoprocessors() changed this


      if (findCoprocessor(className) != null) {

        continue;

      }

to something like this:


      if (findCoprocessor(className) != null || configured.contains(className)) {

        continue;

      }

and in the shell's admin.rb change the code in alter to use addCoprocessor - the whole "finding a new ID" is already taken care of in that method anyways. So this also simplifies code.

Then check the other loadCoprocessors() classes to be safe too.
Whoops, here the online version if that helps: https://www.evernote.com/l/ACFO6OrjlNNHeZDPxhubGw8uDUSwAaOgxQU
Yes, and I hope I have that describe completely in the attach PDF (or the linked note). If not, please add here.
First cut. Fixes the two places Lars George identifies as locations from where we can double load a coprocessor. Adds guard against using HTD#setValue to load coprocessors. Also adds tests.

v2

In HTD, add check in setValue that prevents adding coprocessor via this means that skirts checks for such as duplicate loadings. This is a change in (an exotic) behavior.

Adds to HTD, addCoprocessorWithSpecStr for shell to call in place of setValue.

Some small refactoring in HTD to avoid duplicated code.

In HConstants, add doc around CP_HTD_ATTR_VALUE_PATTERN since it foregrounded by the changes in here.

In CoprocessorHost, guard against double-loading a cp in current session.

Add some tests. No shell test added because it has test to add cp already so at least we have not broken loading cp by shell
Address Andy's review from rb.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 5 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.7.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TestCheckTestClasses

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Prevent Coprocessors being doubly-loaded; a particular coprocessor can only be loaded once.
